intro: Erica lecomtei subsp. lecomtei, commonly known as Lecomte's heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and evergreen plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. Erica lecomtei subsp. lecomtei is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to Mediterranean climates.
